org.anchoranalysis.plot.bean

Class Plot<T>

  • Object
    • AnchorBean<Plot<T>>
      • Plot<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - item-type

    public abstract class Plot<T>
extends AnchorBean<Plot<T>>
    Defines a plot as a function of data and axis-limits.

    Every plot describes items of type T that are variously illustrated on the plot.

    Author:
    Owen Feehan

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public abstract PlotInstance create(Iterator<T> items,
                                    Optional<AxisLimits> domainLimits,
                                    Optional<AxisLimits> rangeLimits)
                             throws CreateException
        Creates a graph
        Parameters:
        items - the items which determine the graph contents
        domainLimits - limits on X axis
        rangeLimits - limits on Y axis or (empty() and then they are guessed automatically)
        Returns:
        a newly created instance of the plot
        Throws:
        CreateException - if anything goes wrong

      • isItemIncluded

        public abstract boolean isItemIncluded(T item)
        Whether to include this particular item in the plot?

        This function is called for all items passed in create(Iterator, Optional, Optional) to filter items that are unwanted or contain undefined or invalid data.

        Parameters:
        item - the item to test
        Returns:
        true iff the item should be included

      • getTitle

        public abstract String getTitle()
        The full title of the plot.
        Returns:
        the title

      • getShortTitle

        public abstract String getShortTitle()
        A shortened version of getTitle().
        Returns:
        the shortened title
